metadata.title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5
metadata.description: The operating system installed on the system is Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5

criterion.comment: Installed operating system is part of the unix family
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 is installed

metadata.title: The operating system installed on the system is Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 for x64
metadata.description: The operating system installed on the system is Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 for x64.

metadata.title: Ensure that /tmp has its own partition or logical volume
metadata.description: The /tmp directory is a world-writable directory used for temporary ﬁle storage. Verify that it has its own partition or logical volume.

criterion.comment: Check in /etc/fstab for a /tmp mount point

metadata.title: Ensure that /var has its own partition or logical volume
metadata.description: The /var directory is used by daemons and other system services to store frequently-changing data. It is not uncommon for the /var directory to contain world-writable directories, installed by other software packages. Ensure that /var has its own partition or logical volume.

criterion.comment: Check in /etc/fstab for a /var mount point

metadata.title: Ensure that /var/log has its own partition or logical volume
metadata.description: System logs are stored in the /var/log directory. Ensure that it has its own partition or logical volume.

criterion.comment: Check in /etc/fstab for a /var/log mount point

metadata.title: Ensure that /var/log/audit has its own partition or logical volume
metadata.description: Audit logs are stored in the /var/log/audit directory. Ensure that it has its own partition or logical volume. Make absolutely certain that it is large enough to store all audit logs that will be created by the auditing daemon.

criterion.comment: Check in /etc/fstab for a /var/log/audit mount point

metadata.title: Ensure that /home has its own partition or logical volume
metadata.description: If user home directories will be stored locally, create a separate partition for /home. If /home will be mounted from another system such as an NFS server, then creating a separate partition is not necessary at this time, and the mountpoint can instead be conﬁgured later.

criterion.comment: Check in /etc/fstab for a /home mount point

metadata.title: Ensure that GPG Key for Red Hat Network is installed
metadata.description: The GPG key should be installed.

extend_definition.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 is installed

metadata.title: Disable the rhnsd Daemon
metadata.description: The rhnsd service should be disabled.

extend_definition.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 is installed

criterion.comment: Check that rhnsd service is not running
Check that rhnsd service is not running
Check that rhnsd service is not running
Check that rhnsd service is not running
Check that rhnsd service is not running
Check that rhnsd service is not running
Check that rhnsd service is not running

metadata.title: yum-updatesd service should be disabled
metadata.description: The yum-updatesd service should be disabled

criterion.comment: check that yum-updatesd service is disabled
check that yum-updatesd service is disabled
check that yum-updatesd service is disabled
check that yum-updatesd service is disabled
check that yum-updatesd service is disabled
check that yum-updatesd service is disabled
check that yum-updatesd service is disabled

metadata.title: Ensure gpgcheck is Globally Activated
metadata.description: The gpgcheck option should be used to ensure that checking of an RPM package’s signature always occurs prior to its installation./

metadata.title: Ensure Package Signature Checking is Not Disabled For Any Repos
metadata.description: To ensure that signature checking is not disabled for any repos, ensure that the following line DOES NOT appear in any repo conﬁguration ﬁles in /etc/yum.repos.d or elsewhere

metadata.title: Install AIDE
metadata.description: The AIDE package should be installed

metadata.title: Verify Package Integrity Using RPM
metadata.description: >Verify the integrity of installed packages by comparing the installed ﬁles with information about the ﬁles taken from the package metadata stored in the RPM database.

metadata.title: Add nodev Option to Non-Root Local Partitions
metadata.description: The nodev option should be enabled for all non-root partitions.

metadata.title: Add nodev Option to Removable Media Partitions
metadata.description: The nodev option should be enabled for all removable media.

metadata.title: Add noexec Option to Removable Media Partitions
metadata.description: The noexec option should be enabled for all removable media.

metadata.title: Add nosuid Option to Removable Media Partitions
metadata.description: The nosuid option should be enabled for all removable media.

metadata.title: Disable Mounting of cramfs
metadata.description: prevents usage of this uncommon ﬁlesystems.

metadata.title: Disable Mounting of freevxfs
metadata.description: prevents usage of this uncommon ﬁlesystems.

metadata.title: Disable Mounting of jffs2
metadata.description: prevents usage of this uncommon ﬁlesystems.

metadata.title: Disable Mounting of hfs
metadata.description: prevents usage of this uncommon ﬁlesystems.

metadata.title: Disable Mounting of hfsplus
metadata.description: prevents usage of this uncommon ﬁlesystems.

metadata.title: Disable Mounting of squashfs
metadata.description: prevents usage of this uncommon ﬁlesystems.

metadata.title: Disable Mounting of udf
metadata.description: prevents usage of this uncommon ﬁlesystems.

metadata.title: Verify user who owns 'shadow' file
metadata.description: The /etc/shadow file should be owned by the appropriate user.

metadata.title: Verify group who owns 'shadow' file
metadata.description: The /etc/shadow file should be owned by the appropriate group.

metadata.title: Verify user who owns 'group' file
metadata.description: The /etc/group file should be owned by the appropriate user.

metadata.title: Verify group who owns 'group' file
metadata.description: The /etc/group file should be owned by the appropriate group.

metadata.title: Verify user who owns 'gshadow' file
metadata.description: The /etc/gshadow file should be owned by the appropriate user.

metadata.title: Verify group who owns 'gshadow' file
metadata.description: The /etc/gshadow file should be owned by the appropriate group.

metadata.title: Verify user who owns 'passwd' file
metadata.description: The /etc/passwd file should be owned by the appropriate user.

metadata.title: Verify group who owns 'passwd' file
metadata.description: The /etc/passwd file should be owned by the appropriate group.

metadata.title: Verify permissions on 'shadow' file
metadata.description: File permissions for /etc/shadow should be set correctly.

metadata.title: Verify permissions on 'group' file
metadata.description: File permissions for /etc/group should be set correctly.

metadata.title: Verify permissions on 'gshadow' file
metadata.description: File permissions for /etc/gshadow should be set correctly.

metadata.title: Verify permissions on 'passwd' file
metadata.description: File permissions for /etc/passwd should be set correctly.

metadata.title: Verify that All World-Writable Directories Have Sticky Bits Set
metadata.description: The sticky bit should be set for all world-writable directories.

criterion.comment: Check all directories and make sure they are either not world writable or if they are they have the sticky bit set

metadata.title: Find Unauthorized World-Writable Files
metadata.description: The world-write permission should be disabled for all files.

criterion.comment: Check all (regular) files and make sure they are not world writable

metadata.title: Find Unauthorized SGID System Executables
metadata.description: The sgid bit should be set only for specified files.

criterion.comment: Check all files and make sure only authorized files have sgid set

metadata.title: Find Unauthorized SUID System Executables
metadata.description: The suid bit should be set only for specified files.

criterion.comment: Check all files and make sure only authorized files have suid set

metadata.title: Find files unowned by a user
metadata.description: All files should be owned by a user

criterion.comment: Check all files and make sure they are owned by a user

metadata.title: Find files unowned by a group
metadata.description: All files should be owned by a group

criterion.comment: Check all files and make sure they are owned by a group

metadata.title: Find world writable directories not owned by a system account
metadata.description: All world writable directories should be owned by a system user

criterion.comment: Check all directories are not world writable or owned by a user with uid less than 500

metadata.title: Set Daemon umask
metadata.description: The daemon umask should be set as appropriate

metadata.title: Disable Core Dumps
metadata.description: Core dumps for all users should be disabled

metadata.title: Disable Core Dumps for setuid programs
metadata.description: Core dumps for setuid programs should be disabled

criterion.comment: Are core dumps for setuid programs disabled?

metadata.title: Enable ExecShield
metadata.description: ExecShield should be enabled

metadata.title: Enable ExecShield randomized placement of virtual memory regions
metadata.description: ExecShield randomized placement of virtual memory regions should be enabled

criterion.comment: check ExecShield randomized placement of virtual memory regions

metadata.title: Install New Kernel on Supported x86 Systems
metadata.description: Kernel support for the XD/NX processor feature should be enabled

metadata.title: Restrict Root Logins to System Console
metadata.description: Logins through the primary console device should be disabled

metadata.title: Restrict Root Logins to System Console
metadata.description: Login prompts on serial ports should be disabled.

metadata.title: Limit su Access to the wheel group
metadata.description: The wheel group should exist

metadata.title: Limit command Access to the Root Account
metadata.description: Command access to the root account should be restricted to the wheel group.

metadata.title: Block Shell and Login Access for Non-Root System Accounts
metadata.description: Login access to non-root system accounts should be disabled

criterion.comment: check /etc/passwd for /sbin/nologin on non root system accounts

metadata.title: Verify that No Accounts Have Empty Password Fields
metadata.description: Login access to accounts without passwords should be disabled

metadata.title: Verify that All Account Password Hashes are Shadowed
metadata.description: Check that passwords are shadowed

metadata.title: Verify that No Non-Root Accounts Have UID 0
metadata.description: Anonymous root logins are disabled

metadata.title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
metadata.description: The password minimum length should be set appropriately

metadata.title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
metadata.description: The "minimum password age" policy should meet minimum requirements.

metadata.title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
metadata.description: The "maximum password age" policy should meet minimum requirements.

metadata.title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
metadata.description: The password warn age should be set appropriately

metadata.title: Remove Legacy + Entries from Password Files
metadata.description: NIS file inclusions should be set appropriately in the /etc/shadow file

metadata.title: Remove Legacy + Entries from Password Files
metadata.description: NIS file inclusions should be set appropriately in the /etc/group file

metadata.title: Remove Legacy + Entries from Password Files
metadata.description: NIS file inclusions should be set appropriately in the /etc/passwd file

metadata.title: Set Password retry Requirements
metadata.description: The password retry should meet minimum requirements using pam_cracklib

metadata.title: Set Password dcredit Requirements
metadata.description: The password dcredit should meet minimum requirements using pam_cracklib

metadata.title: Set Password ucredit Requirements
metadata.description: The password ucredit should meet minimum requirements using pam_cracklib

metadata.title: Set Password ocredit Requirements
metadata.description: The password ocredit should meet minimum requirements using pam_cracklib

metadata.title: Set Password lcredit Requirements
metadata.description: The password lcredit should meet minimum requirements using pam_cracklib

metadata.title: Set Password difok Requirements
metadata.description: The password difok should meet minimum requirements using pam_cracklib

metadata.title: Set deny for Failed Password Attempts
metadata.description: The "account deny" policy should meet minimum requirements.

criterion.comment: check that deny for pam_tally2 account module is configured correctly

metadata.title: Set Password hashing algorithm
metadata.description: The password hashing algorithm should be set correctly.

metadata.title: Limit password reuse
metadata.description: The passwords to remember should be set correctly.

criterion.comment: remember parameter is set to 0 (note this is negated)
check the /etc/pam.d/system-auth password module has a remember option set appropriately

metadata.title: Ensure that No Dangerous Directories Exist in Root's Path
metadata.description: The PATH variable should be set correctly for user root

criteria.comment: PATH starts with ':' or '.', path contains '::' or ':.:' or path ends with ':' or '.'

criterion.comment: PATH starts with ':' or '.', path contains '::' or ':.:' or path ends with ':' or '.'

metadata.title: Write permissions are disabled for group and other in all directories in Root's Path
metadata.description: Check each directory in root's path and make use it does not grant write permission to group and other

criteria.comment: Check that write permission to group and other in root's path is denied

criterion.comment: Check for write permission to group in root's path
Check for write permission to other in root's path

metadata.title: Ensure that User Home Directories are not Group-Writable or World-Readable
metadata.description: File permissions should be set correctly for the home directories for all user accounts.

criteria.comment: Both criterion are negated to get desired result

metadata.title: Ensure that Users Have Sensible Umask Values set for bash
metadata.description: The default umask for all users should be set correctly for the bash shell

metadata.title: Ensure that Users Have Sensible Umask Values set for csh
metadata.description: The default umask for all users should be set correctly for the csh shell

metadata.title: Ensure that Users Have Sensible Umask Values in /etc/login.defs
metadata.description: The default umask for all users should be set correctly

metadata.title: Ensure that Users Have Sensible Umask Values in /etc/profile
metadata.description: The default umask for all users should be set correctly

metadata.title: Set Boot Loader Password
metadata.description: The /boot/grub/grub.conf file should be owned by the appropriate user.

metadata.title: Set Boot Loader Password
metadata.description: The /boot/grub/grub.conf file should be owned by the appropriate group.

metadata.title: Set Boot Loader Password
metadata.description: File permissions for /boot/grub/grub.conf should be set correctly.

metadata.title: Set Boot Loader Password
metadata.description: The grub boot loader should have password protection enabled

metadata.title: Require Authentication for Single-User Mode
metadata.description: The requirement for a password to boot into single-user mode should be configured correctly.

metadata.title: Disable Interactive Boot
metadata.description: The ability for users to perform interactive startups should be disabled.

metadata.title: Configure GUI Screen Locking
metadata.description: The allowed period of inactivity gnome desktop lockout should be configured correctly.

criterion.comment: check value of idle_delay in GCONF

metadata.title: Implement idle activation of screen saver
metadata.description: Idle activation of the screen saver should be enabled.

criterion.comment: check value of idle_activation_enabled in GCONF

metadata.title: Implement idle activation of screen lock
metadata.description: Idle activation of the screen lock should be enabled.

criterion.comment: check value of lock_enabled in GCONF

metadata.title: Implement blank screen saver
metadata.description: The screen saver should be blank.

criterion.comment: check value of mode in GCONF

metadata.title: Configure GUI Screen Locking
metadata.description: The vlock package should be installed

metadata.title: Modify the System Login Banner
metadata.description: The system login banner text should be set correctly.

metadata.title: Implement a GUI Warning Banner
metadata.description: The direct gnome login warning banner should be set correctly.

metadata.title: Ensure SELinux is Properly Enabled
metadata.description: Check output of /usr/sbin/sestatus or check if /selinux exists.

metadata.title: Enable SELinux
metadata.description: SELinux should be enabled

metadata.title: Enable SELinux state
metadata.description: The SELinux state should be set appropriately.

metadata.title: Enable SELinux
metadata.description: The SELinux policy should be set appropriately.

metadata.title: Disable MCS Translation Service (mcstrans) if Possible
metadata.description: The mcstrans service should be disabled.

metadata.title: Check for Unconfined Daemons
metadata.description: Check for device ﬁle that is not labeled.

metadata.title: Network Parameters for Hosts Only
metadata.description: The default setting for sending ICMP redirects should be disabled for network interfaces.

metadata.title: Network Parameters for Hosts Only
metadata.description: Sending ICMP redirects should be disabled for all interfaces.

metadata.title: Network Parameters for Hosts Only
metadata.description: IP forwarding should be disabled.

metadata.title: Network Parameters for Hosts and Routers
metadata.description: Accepting source routed packets should be enabled or disabled for all interfaces as appropriate.

metadata.title: Network Parameters for Hosts and Routers
metadata.description: Accepting ICMP redirects should be enabled or disabled for all interfaces as appropriate.

metadata.title: Network Parameters for Hosts and Routers
metadata.description: Accepting "secure" ICMP redirects (those from gateways listed in the default gateways list) should be enabled or disabled for all interfaces as appropriate.

metadata.title: Network Parameters for Hosts and Routers
metadata.description: Logging of "martian" packets (those with impossible addresses) should be enabled or disabled for all interfaces as appropriate.

metadata.title: Network Parameters for Hosts and Routers
metadata.description: The default setting for accepting source routed packets should be enabled or disabled for network interfaces as appropriate.

metadata.title: Network Parameters for Hosts and Routers
metadata.description: The default setting for accepting ICMP redirects should be enabled or disabled for network interfaces as appropriate.

metadata.title: Network Parameters for Hosts and Routers
metadata.description: The default setting for accepting "secure" ICMP redirects (those from gateways listed in the default gateways list) should be enabled or disabled for network interfaces as appropriate.

metadata.title: Network Parameters for Hosts and Routers
metadata.description: Ignoring ICMP echo requests (pings) sent to broadcast / multicast addresses should be enabled or disabled as appropriate.

metadata.title: Network Parameters for Hosts and Routers
metadata.description: Ignoring bogus ICMP responses to broadcasts should be enabled or disabled as appropriate.

metadata.title: Network Parameters for Hosts and Routers
metadata.description: Sending TCP syncookies should be enabled or disabled as appropriate.

metadata.title: Network Parameters for Hosts and Routers
metadata.description: Performing source validation by reverse path should be enabled or disabled for all interfaces as appropriate.

metadata.title: Network Parameters for Hosts and Routers
metadata.description: The default setting for performing source validation by reverse path should be enabled or disabled for network interfaces as appropriate.

metadata.title: Deactivate Wireless Interfaces
metadata.description: All wireless interfaces should be disabled.

metadata.title: Disable IPv6 address assignment
metadata.description: Automatic IPv6 address assignment should be disabled.

criterion.comment: ipv6 option disable=1 set for modprobe

metadata.title: Disable Interface Usage of IPv6
metadata.description: The default setting for IPv6 configuration should be disabled for network interfaces.

criteria.comment: Either IPv6 kernel module is not loaded or this feature should be disabled

extend_definition.comment: Automatic loading of the IPv6 kernel module should be disabled

metadata.title: Disable Interface Usage of IPv6
metadata.description: Global IPv6 initialization should be disabled.

criteria.comment: Either IPv6 kernel module is not loaded or this feature should be disabled

extend_definition.comment: Automatic loading of the IPv6 kernel module should be disabled

metadata.title: Disable Interface Usage of IPv6
metadata.description: IPv6 configuration should be disabled for all interfaces.

criteria.comment: Either IPv6 kernel module is not loaded or this feature should be disabled

extend_definition.comment: Automatic loading of the IPv6 kernel module should be disabled

metadata.title: Disable Automatic Configuration
metadata.description: The default setting for accepting IPv6 router advertisements should be disabled for network interfaces. (and dependencies are met)

criteria.comment: Either IPv6 kernel module is not loaded or this feature should be disabled

extend_definition.comment: Automatic loading of the IPv6 kernel module should be disabled

metadata.title: Disable Automatic Configuration
metadata.description: Accepting redirects from IPv6 routers should be disabled as appropriate for all network interfaces. (and dependencies are met)

criteria.comment: Either IPv6 kernel module is not loaded or this feature should be disabled

extend_definition.comment: Automatic loading of the IPv6 kernel module should be disabled

metadata.title: Verify ip6tables is enabled
metadata.description: The ip6tables service should be enabled.

criteria.comment: Either IPv6 is disabled or this feature should be

extend_definition.comment: The default setting for IPv6 configuration should be disabled for network interfaces
Global IPv6 initialization should be disabled
IPv6 configuration should be disabled for all interfaces

metadata.title: Inspect and Activate Default Rules
metadata.description: The iptables service should be enabled.

metadata.title: Change the default policy to DROP (from ACCEPT) for the INPUT built-in chain
metadata.description: Change the default policy to DROP (from ACCEPT) for the INPUT built-in chain.

metadata.title: Disable Support for DCCP
metadata.description: Support for DCCP should be disabled.

metadata.title: Disable Support for SCTP
metadata.description: Support for SCTP should be disabled.

metadata.title: Disable Support for RDS
metadata.description: Support for RDS should be disabled.

metadata.title: Disable Support for TIPC
metadata.description: Support for TIPC should be disabled.

metadata.title: The rsyslog package should be installed or uninstalled as appropriate.
metadata.description: The rsyslog package should be installed or uninstalled as appropriate.

criterion.comment: Check to see if rsylog is installed

metadata.title: Configure Rsyslog
metadata.description: The syslog service should be enabled or disabled as appropriate.

metadata.title: Confirm Existence and Permissions of System Log Files
metadata.description: All rsyslog log files should be owned by root user.

criterion.comment: check if user root owns all syslog log files

metadata.title: Confirm Existence and Permissions of System Log Files
metadata.description: All syslog log files should be owned by the appropriate group.

criterion.comment: check if group root owns all syslog log files

metadata.title: Confirm Existence and Permissions of System Log Files
metadata.description: File permissions for all syslog log files should be set correctly.

criterion.comment: check permissions of all syslog log files

metadata.title: Send Logs to a Remote Loghost
metadata.description: Syslog logs should be sent to a remote loghost

metadata.title: Disable Rsyslogd from Accepting Remote Messages on Loghosts Only
metadata.description: RSyslogd should reject remote messages

metadata.title: Ensure All Logs are Rotated by logrotate
metadata.description: The logrotate (syslog rotater) service should be enabled.

metadata.title: Enable the auditd Service
metadata.description: The auditd service should be enabled.

metadata.title: Enable Auditing for Processes Which Start Prior to the Audit Daemon
metadata.description: Look for argument audit=1 in the kernel line in /boot/grub/grub.conf

metadata.title: Records Events that Modify Date and Time Information
metadata.description: Audit rules about time are enabled

criteria.comment: check for 32-bit rules

criterion.comment: check that 32-bit arch is irrelevant for this architecture
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=ARCH -S adjtimex -S settimeofday -S stime -k time-change
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=ARCH -S clock_settime -F a0=0 -k time-change

criteria.comment: check for 64-bit rules

criterion.comment: check that 64-bit arch is irrelevant for this architecture
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=ARCH -S adjtimex -S settimeofday -S stime -k time-change
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=ARCH -S clock_settime -F a0=0 -k time-change

metadata.title: Record Events that Modify User/Group Information
metadata.description: Audit rules about User/Group Information are enabled

metadata.title: Record Events that Modify the System’s Network Environment
metadata.description: Audit rules about the System’s Network Environment are enabled

criteria.comment: check for 32-bit rules

criterion.comment: check that 32-bit arch is irrelevant for this architecture
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a exit,always -F arch=ARCH -S sethostname -S setdomainname -k system-locale

criteria.comment: check for 64-bit rules

criterion.comment: check that 64-bit arch is irrelevant for this architecture
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a exit,always -F arch=ARCH -S sethostname -S setdomainname -k system-locale

metadata.title: Record Events that Modify the System’s Mandatory Access Controls
metadata.description: Audit rules about the System’s Mandatory Access Controls are enabled

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Logon and Logout Events
metadata.description: Audit rules about the Logon and Logout Events are enabled

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Process and Session Initiation Information
metadata.description: Audit rules about the Process and Session Initiation Information are enabled

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Discretionary Access Control Permission Modiﬁcation Events
metadata.description: Audit rules about the Discretionary Access Control Permission Modiﬁcation Events are enabled

criteria.comment: check for 32-bit rules

criterion.comment: check that 32-bit arch is irrelevant for this architecture
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=ARCH -S chmod -S fchmod -S fchmodat -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=ARCH -S chown -S fchown -S fchownat -S lchown -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=ARCH -S setxattr -S lsetxattr -S fsetxattr -S removexattr -S lremovexattr -S fremovexattr -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod

criteria.comment: check for 64-bit rules

criterion.comment: check that 64-bit arch is irrelevant for this architecture
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=ARCH -S chmod -S fchmod -S fchmodat -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=ARCH -S chown -S fchown -S fchownat -S lchown -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=ARCH -S setxattr -S lsetxattr -S fsetxattr -S removexattr -S lremovexattr -S fremovexattr -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Unauthorized Access Attempts to Files (unsuccessful)
metadata.description: Audit rules about the Unauthorized Access Attempts to Files (unsuccessful) are enabled

criteria.comment: check for 32-bit rules

criterion.comment: check that 32-bit arch is irrelevant for this architecture
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=ARCH -S creat -S open -S openat -S truncate -S ftruncate -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=ARCH -S creat -S open -S openat -S truncate -S ftruncate -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

criteria.comment: check for 64-bit rules

criterion.comment: check that 64-bit arch is irrelevant for this architecture
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=ARCH -S creat -S open -S openat -S truncate -S ftruncate -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=ARCH -S creat -S open -S openat -S truncate -S ftruncate -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands
metadata.description: Audit rules about the Information on the Use of Privileged Commands are enabled

criterion.comment: /etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F path=/bin/ping -F perm=x -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k privileged

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on Exporting to Media (successful)
metadata.description: Audit rules about the Information on Exporting to Media (successful) are enabled

criteria.comment: check for 32-bit rules

criterion.comment: check that 32-bit arch is irrelevant for this architecture
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=ARCH -S mount -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k export

criteria.comment: check for 64-bit rules

criterion.comment: check that 64-bit arch is irrelevant for this architecture
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=ARCH -S mount -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k export

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Files Deletion Events by User (successful and unsuccessful)
metadata.description: Audit rules about the Files Deletion Events by User (successful and unsuccessful) are enabled

criteria.comment: check for 32-bit rules

criterion.comment: check that 32-bit arch is irrelevant for this architecture
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=ARCH -S unlink -S unlinkat -S rename -S renameat -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k delete

criteria.comment: check for 64-bit rules

criterion.comment: check that 64-bit arch is irrelevant for this architecture
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=ARCH -S unlink -S unlinkat -S rename -S renameat -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k delete

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects System Administrator Actions
metadata.description: Audit rules about the System Administrator Actions are enabled

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on Kernel Module Loading and Unloading
metadata.description: Audit rules about the Information on Kernel Module Loading and Unloading.

metadata.title: Make the auditd Conﬁguration Immutable
metadata.description: Force a reboot to change audit rules is enabled

metadata.title: Inetd and Xinetd
metadata.description: The inetd service should be disabled.

criteria.comment: inetd is not installed or conditions are met

metadata.description: Require samba clients running smbclient to use packet signing. A Samba client should only communicate with servers who can support SMB packet signing.

criterion.comment: check for client signing = mandatory in /etc/samba/smb.conf

metadata.title: Require Client SMB Packet Signing, if using mount.cifs
metadata.description: Require packet signing of clients who mount Samba shares using the mount.cifs program (e.g., those who specify shares in /etc/fstab). To do so, ensure that signing options (either sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i) are used.

criterion.comment: check for sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i in /etc/fstab
check for sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i in /etc/mtab

check the configuration of /etc/pam.d/system-auth
check the configuration of /etc/pam.d/system-auth

check the /etc/libuser.conf file for the crypt_style setting

ind-def:variable_test.comment: check remember parameter is set to 0

ind-def:textfilecontent54_test.comment: check that remember is set appropriately in /etc/pam.d/system-auth

unix-def:file_test.comment: Check that write permission to group and other in root's path is denied
Check that write permission to group and other in root's path is denied

Tests the value of the PROMPT[\s]*=[\s]*([^#]*) expression in the /etc/sysconfig/init file

ind-def:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Tests the value of the (.*) setting in the /etc/issue file

/selinux/enforce is 1

Tests the value of the ^[\s]*net\.ipv4\.conf\.all\.send_redirects[\s]*=[\s]*([\S].*) expression in the /etc/sysctl.conf file

Tests the value of the ^[\s]*net\.ipv4\.conf\.all\.accept_redirects[\s]*=[\s]*([\S].*) expression in the /etc/sysctl.conf file
Tests the value of the ^[\s]*net\.ipv4\.conf\.all\.secure_redirects[\s]*=[\s]*([\S].*) expression in the /etc/sysctl.conf file

Tests the value of the ^[\s]*net\.ipv4\.conf\.default\.accept_redirects[\s]*=[\s]*([\S].*) expression in the /etc/sysctl.conf file
Tests the value of the ^[\s]*net\.ipv4\.conf\.default\.secure_redirects[\s]*=[\s]*([\S].*) expression in the /etc/sysctl.conf file

Tests the value of the ^[\s]*NETWORKING_IPV6[\s]*=[\s]*([^#]*) expression in the /etc/sysconfig/network file

Check /etc/sysconfig/iptables for line :INPUT ACCEPT [0:0]

use extended content to evaluated this test

ind-def:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Tests the value of the \*\.\*[\s]+@ setting in the /etc/syslog.conf file
Ensure that the /etc/rsyslog.conf does not contain $InputTCPServerRun | $InputUDPServerRun | $InputRELPServerRun

ind-def:unknown_test.comment: use extended content to evaluated this test

ind-def:textfilecontent54_test.comment: check for audit=1 in /boot/grub/grub.conf
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S adjtimex -S settimeofday -S stime -k time-change
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S clock_settime -F a0=0 -k time-change
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S adjtimex -S settimeofday -S stime -k time-change
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S clock_settime -F a0=0 -k time-change
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -w /etc/localtime -p wa -k time-change
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -w /etc/group -p wa -k identity
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -w /etc/passwd -p wa -k identity
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -w /etc/gshadow -p wa -k identity
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -w /etc/shadow -p wa -k identity
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -w /etc/security/opasswd -p wa -k identity
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a exit,always -F arch=b32 -S sethostname -S setdomainname -k system-locale

ind-def:textfilecontent54_test.comment: /etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S unlink -S unlinkat -S rename -S renameat -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k delete

unix-def:uname_test.comment: check architecture does not run 64-bit applications

ind-def:textfilecontent54_test.comment: /etc/audit/audit.rules contains -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S unlink -S unlinkat -S rename -S renameat -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k delete

/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -w /sbin/insmod -p x -k modules
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -w /sbin/rmmod -p x -k modules
/etc/audit/audit.rules contains -w /sbin/modprobe -p x -k modules

look in /etc/audit/audit.rules for -e 2
